intro: Melandrium violascens, commonly known as the purpleleslie or the common lesle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy appearance. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
